directions:
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat
 Add onion and minced garlic and sauté until translucent
 Add ground beef and cook until browned
 Stir in tomato paste and crushed tomatoes
 Simmer sauce for 20 minutes
 Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package instructions
 Drain pasta and combine with sauce
 Garnish with fresh basil and serve.
notes: Let the sauce simmer longer for richer flavor. Leftovers can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days. For best results, use freshly grated Parmesan cheese when serving.

directions:
Cut chicken into strips
 Heat vegetable oil in a wok over high heat
 Add chicken and cook until no longer pink
 Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 1 minute
 Add broccoli, bell pepper, and carrot and cook until crisp-tender
 Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil
 Cook for another 2 minutes
 Serve immediately.
notes: Works great over rice or noodles. You can substitute any vegetables you have on hand. For extra spice, add red pepper flakes or sriracha sauce.

directions:
Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium heat
 Stir in taco seasoning and water according to package instructions
 Cook until sauce thickens
 Warm taco shells according to package directions
 Assemble tacos with beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomato, diced onion, shredded cheddar, and a dollop of sour cream
 Serve immediately.
notes: Set up a taco bar for family dinners! You can prepare the beef ahead of time and reheat when ready to serve. Try adding avocado, jalapeños, or hot sauce for extra flavor.

directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F
 Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with foil
 In a bowl, mix olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper
 Brush mixture over salmon
 Bake for 12-15 minutes until cooked through
 Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.
notes: Salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork. Don't overcook as it will become dry. Pairs beautifully with roasted asparagus and rice pilaf. Leftover salmon makes great salad topping the next day.

directions:
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat
 Add chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until fragrant
 Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute
 Add mixed vegetables, tomato paste, and coconut milk
 Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes
 Garnish with fresh cilantro
 Serve hot.
notes: This curry tastes even better the next day as the flavors meld together. Serve over basmati rice or with naan bread. You can adjust the spice level by adding more or less curry powder to taste.

directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F
 Pound chicken breasts to even thickness
 Dredge chicken in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs
 Heat olive oil in a skillet and fry chicken until golden brown
 Place chicken in a baking dish, top with tomato sauce and mozzarella
 Bake for 20 minutes until cheese is melted
 Sprinkle with parmesan and serve.
notes: For extra crispy coating, use panko breadcrumbs. Make sure the oil is hot enough before frying to prevent soggy coating. Serve with spaghetti and a side salad for a complete Italian meal.

directions:
In a large skillet, melt butter with olive oil over medium heat
 Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 1 minute
 Add shrimp and cook until pink
 Stir in white wine and lemon juice and simmer for 2 minutes
 Sprinkle with parsley and serve.
notes: Serve immediately over angel hair pasta or with crusty bread to soak up the delicious garlic butter sauce. Don't overcook the shrimp - they should be pink and tender, not rubbery.

directions:
Cook egg noodles according to package instructions and set aside
 In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat
 Add sliced mushrooms, onion, and garlic and cook until softened
 Add beef strips and cook until browned
 Stir in flour to coat
 Add beef broth and simmer until sauce thickens
 Remove from heat and stir in sour cream
 Serve over noodles.
notes: The key to perfect stroganoff is not letting the sour cream boil after adding it - this will cause it to curdle. This recipe freezes well for up to 3 months (freeze before adding the sour cream).

directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F
 Cook rice according to package instructions
 Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds
 In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion and garlic until translucent
 Add ground beef and cook until browned
 Stir in cooked rice and tomato sauce
 Fill peppers with mixture and place in a baking dish
 Top with cheddar cheese
 9. Bake for 30 minutes
 10. Serve hot.
notes: Choose peppers that can stand upright. If they wobble, slice a thin layer off the bottom to create a flat base. These can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 2 days before baking.

directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F
 Cook rice according to package instructions
 Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds
 In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion and garlic until translucent
 Add ground beef and cook until browned
 Stir in cooked rice and tomato sauce
 Fill peppers with mixture and place in a baking dish
 Top with cheddar cheese
 9. Bake for 30 minutes
 10. Serve hot.
notes: Choose peppers that can stand upright. If they wobble, slice a thin layer off the bottom to create a flat base. These can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 2 days before baking.

directions:
Add ground beef, onion, garlic, chili powder, cumin, diced tomatoes, kidney beans, and beef broth to slow cooker
 Stir to combine
 Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours
 Serve warm.
notes: Perfect for meal prep! This chili gets better over time and can be frozen for up to 6 months. Top with shredded cheese, sour cream, and green onions. Great served with cornbread or over baked potatoes.
